result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Status conference on November 15, 2022 at 08:30 am.

*** IN CUSTODY ***

3:39 PM Defendant Nikko Anthony Pawlowski in court.  ADA Timothy Robert Verhoff in court for the State of Wisconsin.
RE: Bail Motion filed by Defendant
Defendant elects to wait to have bail hearing until an attorney is appointed.

*** IN CUSTODY ***

3:39 PM Defendant Nikko Anthony Pawlowski in court.  ADA Timothy Robert Verhoff in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defn is eligible for SPD but waiting for an attorney to be appointed. Court colloquy with Defn regarding time limits for preliminary hearing. Defn elects to waive time limits. STC will be scheduled.
Media Request for Camera in Courtroom - WKOW 27 (granted)
Bail/bond hearing on October 19, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Referral to Dane County Pretrial Services (DCPS)

Cash bail has been set in the amount of $35,000(per case). Defendant must immediately report to Pretrial Services by 10:00 am on the day of release. 
The following checked category(s) are also ordered: _X_ GPS, __ Remote Breath (Alcohol) Monitoring, and/or __ Random Drug Testing. 
NONCOMPLIANCE WILL BE REPORTED BY DCPS TO THE JUDICIARY WHO SHALL RESPOND IN ONE OF THESE WAYS: Schedule bail hearing, Increase Supervision, Issue warrant, No change but monitor. 
- Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with KMR or her children NAP, AJR, JER, & DAP or any other juveniles.
- Defendant shall not be at KMR's residence or American Family Children's Hospital.
Parties did not stipulate to waive the time limits for Preliminary Hearing.
Trial Judge - Br 11

2:12 PM Defendant Nikko Anthony Pawlowski in court in custody.  Attorney Diana Maria Van Rybroek in court for Nikko Anthony Pawlowski.  Prosecuting attorney Tracy L. McMiller in court for the State of Wisconsin. The defendant was advised regarding their right to an attorney and to the SPD application process if not already represented. Defendant received a copy of the Complaint and waived reading. Court entered Not Guilty pleas as to any misdemeanor counts. Victim appeared and made statement.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 19, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
